title: One Dead, 30 Injured After Two Trains Collide Near Machu Picchu | 10 News
description: One person is dead and 30 are injured after two trains bound for Machu Picchu collided on Tuesday, December 30. Police confirmed the deceased was the driver of one of the trains. Among the injured were Peruvian and international tourists, with one reported in serious condition. The collision occurred in a remote mountainous area between the Corihuayrachina and Pampaccahua archaeological sites, approximately 50km from Cusco. Authorities are investigating the cause of the incident. title: What Cost-Of-Living Changes Are Coming For Australians In 2026? | 10 News
description: A number of the federal government’s election promises will come into effect on January 1st. Changes include cheaper prescription medicines under the Pharmaceutical Benefits Scheme, increased payments for those on social security, and more subsidised childcare for families. Australians will also see higher costs for passports, tolls, and energy bills. title: Man Dead And Teenager Missing After Boat Capsizes Off Sydney’s Northern Beaches | 10 News
description: A man is dead and a teenager is missing after a boat capsized off the coast North of Sydney. A desperate search is still underway for the boy, with Marine Rescue assisting police.  Eliot Hastie joins Jayde with the latest. title: Cities Across Australia Prepare To Ring In 2026 | 10 News
description: From Sydney's harbour to the banks of the Yarra River, to a festival in Adelaide, Brisbane's South Bank and Perth's nightlife hotspot, millions of Australians are ready to farewell 2025 and welcome a New Year.  But public events this year have been somewhat shadowed by security concerns, with police in some cities more heavily armed than ever following the Bondi terror attack. title: Local Melbourne Cricket Club’s New Rules Following Death Of 17-Year-Old Player | 10 News
description: A community cricket club in Melbourne’s north has become the first in the world to mandate neck guards for junior players, after a teenage cricketer was killed earlier this year. 17-year-old Ben Austin was hit in the neck by a ball during training in the nets in October, with his death prompting action from the cricket community. title: Russia-Ukraine War Enters New Year As Zelenskyy And Putin Address Nations | 10 News
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and Russian President Vladimir Putin have delivered New Year’s addresses as the Russia-Ukraine war enters another year. In his address, Zelenskyy said Ukraine wanted the war to end but not at any cost, stressing he would not agree to a peace deal that would weaken the country or prolong the conflict. He said Ukrainians were exhausted but not prepared to surrender, saying any suggestion otherwise was mistaken. Putin used his annual televised speech to rally Russian troops fighting in Ukraine, praising them as heroes and expressing confidence in victory. The addresses come as efforts continue to broker an end to the nearly four-year-long war. title: Queen Camilla Reveals She Was Indecently Assaulted On A Train As A Teenager | 10 News
description: Warning: The following content contains the topic of domestic violence. Viewer discretion is advised.    Queen Camilla has shared publicly, for the first time, her experience of indecent assault as a teenager, recalling how “furious” she was about the incident.  The 78-year-old, who has made fighting domestic abuse one of her signature causes, said she had “sort of forgotten” about the experience, but the memory had lurked for a long time.   Camilla described the incident in an interview with BBC Radio 4’s Today programme, during which she also praised the courage of racing commentator John Hunt after his wife and two daughters were killed by one of his daughter's ex-partners. title: Reckless Stunt Caught On Camera At Hawaii's Most Active Volcano | 10 News
description: A reckless stunt at one of the world's most active volcanoes has been caught on camera. Last week, two men were seen walking dangerously close to a lava fountain on Hawaii's Kilauea and gesturing to a US Geological Survey webcam. The area is closed to the public, but the pair's actions have raised safety concerns for visitors across the national park. title: Amsterdam’s Historic Vondelkerk Church Engulfed In Flames During New Year's Celebrations | 10 News
description: A massive fire engulfed the historic Vondelkerk Church in Amsterdam in the early hours of Thursday, following New Year celebrations. The blaze was quickly declared a major fire, with authorities warning the entire building was at risk of collapsing. Within hours, the church tower of the 145-year-old landmark had completely collapsed. Authorities urged residents in nearby areas to stay indoors, close windows and doors, and turn off ventilation, while surrounding homes were evacuated as a precaution. The cause of the fire remains under investigation. title: Sydney Pays Tribute To Bondi Terror Attack Victims As Australia Welcomes 2026 | 10 News
description: Australia has partied well into the early hours to welcome 2026 with fireworks, lasers and drone displays across the nation. But before the greatest show on earth began in Sydney, there was a demonstration of strength and resilience. One million people fell silent across the harbour city, holding candles and torches, in solemn commemoration of those who lost their lives in the Bondi terror attack. title: Two Drown, Two Missing In Multiple Coastal Emergencies Across Sydney | 10 News
description: There has been heartbreak on Sydney's east coast, with two people drowning within 24 hours. The latest victim of the treacherous surf conditions was a young woman thought to be a Chinese national, who was swept off rocks at a popular beach. A teenage boy and a Nepalese student remain missing. title: Top Secret 2005 John Howard Cabinet Documents Made Public | 10 News
description: Top secret documents on the high-level decisions made by Prime Minister John Howard and his cabinet during their time in government in 2005 have been made public. It's part of the National Archives' annual release of records on New Year's Day. And you'd think not much has changed – with issues such as energy, climate change and China all up for debate in cabinet.
